discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A retrospective is a meeting that is typically held at the end of a project, phase, or sprint to reflect on what went well and what could be improved in the future. While a retrospective could potentially be useful in this situation to identify potential issues or problems that may have contributed to the defects in the work product, it would not be the most effective way for the project manager to get to the root cause of the defects. In this situation, it would be more effective for the project manager to conduct a face-to-face meeting with the junior-level engineer to discuss the defects and gather more information about the root cause of the issues.

comments.content: Retrospective meeting, or retro, is a structured session that gives teams time to reflect on a completed project. It allows a team and individuals to highlight both the successes and failures of a project, identify areas that need improvement, and reflect on the project as a whole.

choices.A: The project sponsor should obtain the current status from team members, put it into a presentation, and present it to the project manager for review.
choices.C: The scheduler should obtain the current status from team members, update the project charter, project management plan, dashboard, and SOW, and then create a status report to provide to the project manager.
choices.B: The scheduler should obtain the current status from team members, apply it to the baseline of the schedule, and run a report.
choices.D: The scheduler should obtain the current status from team members, update the risk register, and provide the information to the project champion for review.

questions.question_text: If a project sponsor wants to know the current status and progress of a project, which of the following is the BEST approach to find this information?

discussion.content:
B. The scheduler should obtain the current status from team members, apply it to the baseline of the schedule, and run a report. 

According to the PMBOK, the schedule baseline is the approved version of the schedule model that is used as a basis for comparison to the actual results. 
I think "compare" would be a better word choice than "apply" here (because the schedule baseline does not change) but answer B seems to be correct.

questions.question_text: A stakeholder refuses to sign off on the testing results for a new product, but a functional manager reports the product is ready to be released. Which of the following will identify if the testing results are acceptable?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The quality plan will identify if the testing results are acceptable. The quality plan is a document that outlines the quality standards and guidelines that will be used to ensure that the project deliverables meet the required level of quality. It specifies the quality criteria that must be met, the quality control measures that will be implemented, and the quality assurance processes that will be followed. In this case, the quality plan would provide the necessary guidance for determining whether the testing results for the new product are acceptable and whether the product is ready to be released.

questions.question_text: A project manager realizes more people are needed to complete a deliverable on time and asks the PMO for more resources. This is an example of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This is an example of a resource shortage. A resource shortage occurs when a project lacks the necessary resources (e.g., people, equipment, materials) to complete a particular task or deliverable. In this case, the project manager has recognized that the project does not have enough people to complete the deliverable on time and has asked the PMO for additional resources. This is a common issue that project managers must address in order to ensure that the project stays on track and meets its goals.
